Hello all.  I've been lurking on the list for a while, and have been
interested in NEAT since attending GECCO 2002.  I'm just about to
submit the following as a Sourceforge project:

**** 

REAT (Rete Evolution of Augmenting Topologies) is an attempt to apply
the concepts of Ken Stanley's NEAT (NeuroEvolution of Augmenting
Topologies) to Charles Forgy's Rete network.   This will, hopefully,
enable the evolution of inference rules through continual
complexification of their underlying RETE network.

I intend to develop this in Java, starting from a clean implementation
of the RETE network.

Reference:

NEAT:
http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/project-view.php?RECORD_KEY(Projects)=ProjID&ProjID(Projects)=14
http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/kstanley/neat.html

RETE:
http://herzberg.ca.sandia.gov/jess/docs/52/rete.html
http://www.drools.org/Rete

**** 

I doubt I'll have this anywhere near ready to submit for GECCO 2005,
even for a late breaking paper, but I intend on going just to listen
and learn, and blather about evolving rules to anyone who will listen.
 GECCO 2002 was the first technical conference I'd ever gone to, and
it was a blast.

Anyway, I'd like any comments you all may have, even on this small
hint of a project. :)  Thanks.
